span.a: LINK TO SPRINGTOWN ISD COVID-19 RESPONSE PLAN
COVID-19 Mental Health & Family Wellness Resources

span.p: NEW SCHOOL CLOSURE INFORMATION (4/17/20) -- Governor Abbott's new Executive Order will close Texas' schools for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year. Springtown ISD will continue our efforts to provide distance learning resources so that our students can complete the current term. The Order applies only to students physically attending school in our buildings. The academic year will continue through May 21st via our DISTANCE LEARNING PROGRAM. Students will be expected to continue coursework in order to earn credits at the secondary level or demonstrate preparedness for grade-level promotion in grades k-8.

Our staff is very disappointed to now know with certainty that students will not return to campuses this semester. There are quite a few "end-of-year" procedures and activities impacted by this Order. Campuses will communicate with parents and students over the coming weeks regarding processes through which to retrieve personal items, school supplies, yearbooks, equipment, etc.

More information will be posted very soon. The Districts Leadership Team will continue to communicate with State and Federal agencies and utilize our website, social media, and ParentLink to share new information with all our stakeholders.

div.div: Motto: All students in Springtown Schools will be SAFE, SECURE, and SUCCESSFUL. VISION: To provide efficient and effective school processes which result in success for all students. MISSION: To provide all students with an educational program that will allow them to develop to their potential, to be well-adjusted, and able to make positive contributions to a free enterprise society.
